children.subject: Daily waitlist processing times until about the 3rd week. If you add a class and are waitlisted after 6:40PM, wait until after 12:40AM to send us an email. Many times I'll get emails from students after 5PM (after the office has closed) saying they're waitlisted. When I get into the office the next morning and look them up, they've been enrolled by then. It saves us a lot of time if you wait. Thanks!

Are the times you listed above for today or tomorrow? If the times are for today, can we suppose that after 6:40 PM, all of the waitlists for all classes will be processed since it is the last time of the day?
This is not an appropriate follow-up for this post.
I believe if one person is waitlisted then everyone who tries to enroll will be waitlisted so you don’t need to worry about the scenario you posted
I do not believe that is the case, for example I was able to enroll into data 100 since I had all the prereqs completed, even though there were already 100+ people on the waitlist.

I'm not clear on the details (e.g. if CalCentral only does it if someone on the waitlist meets the same enrollment restrictions that you are aiming for), but my understanding is the same as anon: that (there are at least some situations where) CalCentral will block other students from directly enrolling and skipping the waitlist before the waitlist processes.
I believe that people can skip the waitlist if they fit into the reserved seats (in phase 1&ii), but if there are no reserved seats then waitlist cannot be skipped.

Quick question, just to understand the cal central system. Let's say I am waitlist position 1 for a cs class, with no conflicts to enroll. At 1pm someone drops the class, opening up one spot in lecture. Now, from my understanding, if I don't do anything, I'll be enrolled into the course at 6:40pm. My question is this, could someone at, say 2pm, enroll directly into the class, since there is one spot open. even though there is a waitlist?

Thanks!
@6301 this is a cal central question

I was not quite sure how the swap process worked on CalCentral. Initially, during phase 2, I tried swapping EE 16B, which I was already enrolled in, with CS 61B, which already had a waitlist. I was consequently placed on the waitlist, while staying enrolled in 16B, under the condition that if I got off the waitlist for 61B, I would be dropped from 16B. However, I later dropped EE 16B, and during adjustment enrolled back in it but under a different lab section, while staying under the unit cap of 20.5 units inclusive of my 61B waitlist (4 other courses + 61B waitlist).

I'm now wondering if I will still be dropped from 16B if I get off the 61B waitlist? I plan on taking both this semester and I would like a heads up if I'm going to be booted off 16B 3 or 4 weeks in. Not sure if this is the best place to be asking, but if there's someone else I can contact that can help me figure this out, do let me know!
Is the waitlist processed on weekdays only, or weekends too?
The add deadline is September 12th. At that point, anyone still on the waitlist and not enrolled in the class will be dropped.

I am in the waiting list around 80 for CS 168, according to previous years Berkeley time, I can enroll in the class around end of September, should I continue to do the work since 168 is only open for the fall semester and I am a senior..

history.content:
Hello!

If you see that one of our classes has open seats after looking on classes.berkeley.edu and you then go to add the class, but are waitlisted, PLEASE wait at least till one of the following times passes: 12:40AM, 6:40AM, 12:40PM, 6:40PM. This is when the waitlist processes automatically. It's typical to be added first to the waitlist and then once the waitlist processes, you are enrolled into the class (double check your lab and discussion, if there's no 999 section).

Please wait for the WL to process to see if you're enrolled before contacting myself, Cindy, or any of the advisors. 

----

Note that the automatic waitlist for Fall 2018 stopped on Friday, 9/7/18. At this time you need to either drop and re-add a class to be enrolled or be enrolled manually by Cindy (CS classes) or myself (EE & EECS classes).
